lines.text: Enter SEBASTIAN and Clown

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Will you make me believe that I am not sent for you

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Go to, go to, thou art a foolish fellow: Let me be clear of thee.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Well held out, i faith! No, I do not know you nor I am not sent to you by my lady, to bid you come speak with her nor your name is not Master Cesario nor this is not my nose neither. Nothing that is so is so.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I prithee, vent thy folly somewhere else: Thou knowst not me.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Vent my folly! he has heard that word of some great man and now applies it to a fool. Vent my folly! I am afraid this great lubber, the world, will prove a cockney. I prithee now, ungird thy strangeness and tell me what I shall vent to my lady: shall I vent to her that thou art coming

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I prithee, foolish Greek, depart from me: Theres money for thee: if you tarry longer, I shall give worse payment.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: By my troth, thou hast an open hand. These wise men that give fools money get themselves a good reportafter fourteen years purchase.
Enter SIR ANDREW, SIR TOBY BELCH, and FABIAN

lines.speaker: sir andrew
lines.text: Now, sir, have I met you again theres for you.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Why, theres for thee, and there, and there. Are all the people mad

lines.speaker: sir toby belch
lines.text: Hold, sir, or Ill throw your dagger oer the house.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: This will I tell my lady straight: I would not be in some of your coats for two pence.
Exit

lines.speaker: sir toby belch
lines.text: Come on, sir hold.

lines.speaker: sir andrew
lines.text: Nay, let him alone: Ill go another way to work with him Ill have an action of battery against him, if there be any law in Illyria: though I struck him first, yet its no matter for that.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Let go thy hand.

lines.speaker: sir toby belch
lines.text: Come, sir, I will not let you go. Come, my young soldier, put up your iron: you are well fleshed come on.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I will be free from thee. What wouldst thou now If thou darest tempt me further, draw thy sword.

lines.speaker: sir toby belch
lines.text: What, what Nay, then I must have an ounce or two of this malapert blood from you.
Enter OLIVIA

lines.speaker: olivia
lines.text: Hold, Toby on thy life I charge thee, hold!

lines.speaker: sir toby belch
lines.text: Madam!

lines.speaker: olivia
lines.text: Will it be ever thus Ungracious wretch, Fit for the mountains and the barbarous caves, Where manners neer were preachd! out of my sight! Be not offended, dear Cesario. Rudesby, be gone! I prithee, gentle friend, Let thy fair wisdom, not thy passion, sway In this uncivil and thou unjust extent Against thy peace. Go with me to my house, And hear thou there how many fruitless pranks This ruffian hath botchd up, that thou thereby Mayst smile at this: thou shalt not choose but go: Do not deny. Beshrew his soul for me, He started one poor heart of mine in thee.
Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: What relish is in this how runs the stream Or I am mad, or else this is a dream: Let fancy still my sense in Lethe steep If it be thus to dream, still let me sleep!

lines.speaker: olivia
lines.text: Nay, come, I prithee would thouldst be ruled by me!

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Madam, I will.

lines.speaker: olivia
lines.text: O, say so, and so be!
Exeunt
